technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

effects.description: Increases the amount of Spawning Sequence earned by commandments by: +10%

technology.short_description: It is possible for the Slann to communicate telepathically with their agents in the field, and send visions to guide their hands.
Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.
Compliance without question ensures that the path to the Great Plan remains as clear as possible.
Individual lives are of little importance; in the final analysis only the Great Plan matters.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

technology.short_description: Those Lizardmen destined for leadership roles have exotic skin-markings.

effects.description:
Melee and missile weapon damage: +10%
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The Plan requires that all Lizardmen factions work together for the betterment of the entire race.
Disturbances in the Geomantic Web are detected long before they become viable threats, enabling their sources to be found and purged accordingly.
The insidious taint and corruption of destruction's dark forces must be kept at bay.
In their fathomless wisdom, the Slann Mage-Priests have learned to use the covetous intrusions of the younger races to observe them in turn.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

effects.description: Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Saurus and Temple Guards units (minimum 1)

technology.short_description: This sequence further improves the process of weapon manufacture, ensuring that the Saurus have the very best equipment with which to fight.
Each spawning of Saurus act as one on the battlefield, acting in a perfectly coordinated manner to crush the enemies of the Old Ones.
Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for Skink and Chameleon Skinks units
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Skink units

technology.short_description: The above-ground spawning pools must be prepared; new Skinks will be required if the Plan is to be interpreted on schedule.
Secrets of the Old Ones.

technology.short_description: The riders harass and distract enemy missile troops in battle.

effects.description: Blessed Spawning pool capacity for Blessed Ripperdactyl and Terradon Riders: +2
All enemies have lowered missile weapon range by -20%% during battles

technology.short_description: Sneaky skinks sneakily slink into the enemy backlines and sabotage their arms and armour.

effects.description: Blessed Spawning pool capacity for Blessed Ripperdactyl and Terradon Riders: +2
All enemies have lowered armour by -10% during battles

technology.short_description: Only those among the younger races whose existence adheres to the tenets of the Great Plan are permitted.

effects.description: All regions owned by factions that you have trade agreements with are visible

technology.short_description: Understanding of the Great Plan involves the realisation that others have a role to play.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Humans, High Elves and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: Although the sea is not generally their habitat, amphibious Lizardmen are  used to traverse the hazardous waters when the need arises.
Those spawning pools located underground must be ready - war is always at hand and fresh Saurus will be needed to fight.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Saurus and Temple Guards units

technology.short_description: Gold, found in abundance in Lustria, is used to fashion exquisite armour to cover those parts the Lizardmen's tough scales do not.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +10% for Saurus Infantry and Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: Of the myriad jungle plants, some are poisonous while others stimulate and rejuvenate the Saurus.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for Saurus Infantry and Temple Guard units
Upkeep: -10% for Saurus Infantry and Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: Speed and dexterity on the battlefield are the watchwords here.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Red Crested Skink units
Melee defence: +4 for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units

technology.short_description: Whereby Skinks are trained for battle, focusing on use of their natural agility to damage the foe.

effects.description: Passive ability: Enhanced Spawn Kin for Skink units (Replaces Spawn Kin)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink, Chameleon Stalker and Red Crested Skink units

technology.short_description: The ground is perforated with poisoned javelins; the enemy must move slowly to avoid impaling themselves.

effects.description: Blessed Spawning pool capacity for Blessed Ripperdactyl and Terradon Riders: +2
All enemies have lowered speed by -20%% during battles

technology.short_description: The sound is constant, omnipresent, and terrifying.

effects.description: Blessed Spawning pool capacity for Blessed Ripperdactyl and Terradon Riders: +2
All enemies have lowered melee weapon damage by -10%% during battles

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.
Lizardmen do not tire easily - this sequence ensures that all Saurus spawnings have the required stamina.
Skink warriors are lightly armoured and best-used for skirmish duties in battle.

effects.description: Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for all Skink Infantry units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Skink, Chameleon Skink and Chameleon Stalker units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Skink units

technology.short_description: Of the myriad jungle plants, some are poisonous while others stimulate and rejuvenate the Skinks.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for all Skink and Chameleon Skink Infantry units

technology.short_description: Those who dare to remove the Old Ones' precious legacy from their sacred sites will be obliterated from the face of the world.
Energy can be siphoned from the Geomantic Web to heal or teleport reinforcements to where they are needed most.
As described by the Old Ones, research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan to its ultimate conclusion.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units
Recruit rank: +2 for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units

technology.onscreen_name: Sequence of the Great Beast's Resilience
technology.short_description: Slow-moving but deadly, the Living Bastions of Lustria's armies can be made even tougher by following the Old Ones' teachings.

effects.description: Removes Attribute "Wounds" from (Rank 7 and above) Dread Saurians
Melee defence: +4 for Bastiladon and Stegadon units
Missile resistance: 15% for Bastiladon and Stegadon units

technology.short_description: The bond between beast and rider must not be underestimated.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -10% for mounted characters
	(all characters factionwide)

Speed: +10% for mounted characters
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The ancient technology of the Old Ones is poorly understood... and powerful beyond comprehension.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn

technology.short_description: Some of the more powerful Slann are capable of bestowing magical enchantments on an entire force at once.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: -10% for enemy armies starting their turn in your regions

Enables magical attacks
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: It is our sacred charge to enact the Great Plan and stop the ruination of Chaos. The teachings the Old Ones provide the tools to do so.

effects.description: Immune to Chaos corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

technology.short_description: With mastery of Ghyran we can bring our warriors back from the brink of death.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.onscreen_name: Sequence of the Great Beast's Rampage
technology.short_description: It's best to stay out of a Stegadon's way if you don't want to be trampled or gored, no matter whose side you are on.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units
Charge bonus: +15 for Stegadon, Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units

technology.short_description: Fresh quadruped 'recruits' are always required when war comes to Lustria's jungle shores.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units

technology.short_description: By submerging in the brackish swamps and prowling the labyrinthian undergrowth, even hulking predators can be taught stealth among the wetlands of Lustria.

effects.description: Attribute: Snipe for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit remains hidden while firing.

effects.description: Attribute: Stalk for Salamander and Razordon Hunting Pack units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: The Lizardmen have been here since the very beginning of the world, quite literally. Their command of magic is ancient and foreign.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +25% for all Slann

technology.short_description: Research the following items to advance the Lizardmen's Great Plan even further.
A strict schedule from which the Skinks work to ensure the Great Plan is carried out.
Once new temple-cities are fully connected to the Geomantic Web, future spawnings will be accelerated.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +10% for armies
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: The bigger, stronger, simpler Lizardmen do much of the physical labour in their society.
Every plaza, every ziggurat, every stone - each element must be laid out exactly as the Old Ones decreed.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Correct interpretation is essential if the Great Plan is to be executed to the Old Ones' intended design.

ui_effects.localised_text: Magical unit that can cast spells
Summoned units have specific debuffs conditions
Spawned unit fights in this battle only

technology.short_description: Once the foe's blood begins to flow the Cold Ones go into near-uncontrollable frenzy.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Cold One units
Weapon strength: +10% for Cold One units

technology.short_description: The most irregular weapons are reserved for Terradon Riders, who are armed with poison-tipped javelins, fireleech bolas, and various other unusual ordnances.

effects.description: Base missile damage: -4 for Terradon Rider units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +4 for Terradon Rider units

technology.short_description: In times of trouble the Lizardmen can turn inward both for protection and to conserve.
Tepok the Inscrutable's blessing shall wash all blight upon this land.
With concentration and our most powerful artifacts, Lizardmen spellcasters prove they are without peer.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -20% to all spells
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

technology.short_description: Within the Star Chambers, the Slann meditate and plan the future of their race.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Star Chamber buildings
Construction time: -1 for Star Chamber buildings

technology.short_description: The combination of magical dexterity and the Kroxigor's immense physical strength reduces construction times considerably.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: The world's natural resources are a gift from the Old Ones for the benefit of their race.
The revered Old Ones must be venerated whenever possible.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Cult of Sotek and Cult of the Old Ones buildings
Construction time: -1 for Cult of Sotek and Cult of the Old Ones buildings

technology.short_description: Geomancy can be used to locate the best ore veins, ripe for exploitation.
There are many paths to order and knowledge; may the Old Ones guide us.

effects.description: Leadership +5 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
Tier 4  5 settlements grant province-wide immunity to climate penalties
Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle
Leadership +5 when fighting against armies that spread corruption

technology.short_description: A near-constant state of war should not prevent the construction or management of the temple-cities.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: The most respected of all Saurus Warriors, the Temple Guard are equipped with the finest arms and armour available.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Temple Guard units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10% for Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: By the application of natural sap, the armoured bulk of the Kroxigor can be further strengthened so they survive longer in battle.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units

technology.short_description: The blessing of the three-horned ruler of cold-blooded beasts is evinced by a rank odour that subjugates the nimble but foul-tempered Cold Ones.

effects.description: Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for Cold One Riders, Cold One Spear-Riders and Horned Ones units

technology.short_description: Watchful of the skeins of fate, Skink Priests from the floating temple observe the reptilians' closest to the Sun Lord being galvanised by his power.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units
Melee attack: +10 for Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders and Coatl units

technology.short_description: Lizardmen warriors do not fight for gold or fame, but to enact the will of the Old Ones themselves.
The Lizardmen will never flee nor break, every obstacle that stands in the way of the Great Plan will be razed to the ground.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Lizardmen movements are fluid and decisive, descending upon every foe with terrifying purpose.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% when defending
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The trinkets and baubles that adorn the Lizardmen are not mere decoration.

effects.description: Melee and missile weapon damage: +10% for Blessed units

technology.short_description: Spawned alongside their more chittering kin, Kroxigor will sometimes exhibit more than their fair share of the Skinks' frenzy during battle.

effects.description: Passive ability: Enhanced Spawn Kin for Kroxigor units (Replaces Spawn Kin)

technology.short_description: As some of the strongest Lizardmen, Kroxigor use their bulk to charge and smash through enemy ranks.
The Temple Guard, veterans all and many thousands of years old, are a pinnacle to which all Saurus aspire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Temple Guard units
Melee defence: +5 for Temple Guard units

technology.short_description: The ferocious, predatory Cold Ones can be trained so their savage natures are exploited to the Lizardmen's best advantage.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Cold One units
Attribute: Strider for Cold Ones and Cold One Riders

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

technology.short_description: These directions ensure sufficient numbers of beast-sensitives among Skink and Saurus spawnings.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One units
Recruit rank: +2 for Terradon Riders and Ripperdactyl Riders units

technology.short_description: Perfect mental imprinting and limitless discipline create some of the most effective commanders in the world.
The ability to remain hidden almost anywhere is vital if the foe's intrigues are to be discovered and frustrated.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: By which the Old Ones' agents may be guided remotely, greatly increasing their chances of success.
Between the eerie wail of the Troglodon and the blood-curdling growl of the Carnosaur, Lizardmen have learned to portend the Old Ones' favour from the myriad intonations of the jungle.

effects.description:
Attribute: Immune to Psychology
	(all characters factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: The wisest race is indifferent to pain and fortune's many vicissitudes.
Darting, tireless eyes keep a keen watch on Lizardmen surroundings.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

technology.short_description: Education, both mental and martial, should be ceaseless.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 5

technology.short_description: The Winds infuse our greatest heroes with vitality and confidence.

effects.description: Removes Cause Fear from all enemies

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

technology.short_description: The Children of the Gods loyally obey the commands of the Old Ones. They have built their cities precisely where they are meant to be.

effects.description: Reinforces the Geomantic Web to level 4, indirectly improving commandments
